intro: Batratherum lanceolatum, commonly known as the narrow-leaf battherum, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Asteraceae. It is characterized by its slender, lance-shaped leaves and produces small, yellow flowers arranged in composite heads. Native to South America, particularly Brazil, this species thrives in moist, shaded environments. The plant is often found in forest understories and is adapted to humid tropical climates. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for studies in plant morphology and ecological adaptation.
